required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Musculoskeletal Ultrasound for Diagnosis of Shoulder Dislocation Reduction
clinical_study.official_title: Musculoskeletal Ultrasonography to Diagnose Successful Reduction of Shoulder Dislocation

lead_sponsor.agency: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

clinical_study.source: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the current standard of care post reduction plain film x ray for confirmation of shoulder reduction to point of care ultrasound. Patients will receive both the current standard of care post reduction x ray and point of care ultrasound to act as their own comparators

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of X ray to Ultrasound for Shoulder Reduction
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion up to 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Compare the impression of the x ray to the ultrasound for successful shoulder reduction

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of X ray to Ultrasound in the diagnosis of post shoulder reduction complications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion up to 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Compare the impression of the x ray to the ultrasound for shoulder dislocation complications

arm_group.description: Patients will active as their own comparator

intervention.description: Patients will receive a point of care ultrasound at the bedside in the Emergency Department and compare the impression to the x ray result

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults greater than or equal to 18 years
- Acute shoulder dislocation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Associated fracture
- Associated neurovascular injury

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey
